se450.elevator

Class ElevatorImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • se450.elevator.ElevatorImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, Elevator

    public class ElevatorImpl
extends java.lang.Thread
implements Elevator
    The implementation of Elevator interface. It also extends Thread class. It contains the most important logic for elevator movement.
    Author:
    Shan Gao

    • Constructor Detail

      • ElevatorImpl

        public ElevatorImpl(int elevatorID,
                    int maxPassenger,
                    int maxFloor,
                    int timePerFloor,
                    int timePerDoorOp,
                    int defaultFloor,
                    int timeOut)
             throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
        Constructor of Elevator. Need to input default parameters of this Elevator instance;
        Parameters:
        elevatorID - - The id of this elevator, int.
        maxPassenger - - Max capacity of this elevator, int.
        maxFloor - - Max floor of this elevator will go, int.
        timePerFloor - - How long does this elevator spend per go UP/DOWN 1 floor. Millisecond, int.
        timePerDoorOp - - How long does this elevator spend per door open and then close. Millisecond, int.
        defaultFloor - - Default floor of this elevator, int.
        timeOut - - If this elevator idles longer than this time, it will go to the defaultFloor. Millisecond, int.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidParameterException

      • requestList_toString

        public java.lang.String requestList_toString()
        This method will walk through the request list and return a string for print purpose
        Returns:
        - The current request list with format [Floor Requests: ...] [Rider Requests: ...]

      • distance

        public int distance(Request request)
        Calculate the distance of a request to the elevator based on the current elevator moving direction. This method includes the most important logic to sort request array.
        Parameters:
        request - - The request to be calculated.
        Returns:
        - The number of floors elevator need to go to answer the request.

      • isNearer

        public boolean isNearer(Request r1,
                        Request r2)
        Compare two requests determine which is nearer to current floor based on the current elevator moving direction.
        Parameters:
        r1 - - Request 1.
        r2 - - Request 2.
        Returns:
        - True if request 1 is nearer, False if request 1 is farer.

      • addFloorRequest

        public void addFloorRequest(int floor,
                            DIRECTION direction)
                     throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
        Description copied from interface: Elevator
        This method is the interface for Controller to send a command to the elevator. Means someone pressed UP or DOWN button outside the elevator, then controller decided to ask this elevator to respond.
        Specified by:
        addFloorRequest in interface Elevator
        Parameters:
        floor - - Floor number in int format from 1 to MaxFloor.
        direction - - Emu as in UP, DOWN. Can't be NONE here.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidParameterException
        See Also:
        #panelPressed(int)

      • addRiderRequest

        public void addRiderRequest(int floor)
                     throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
        Description copied from interface: Elevator
        This method is the interface for Person to send a command to the elevator. Means someone pressed a floor number button inside the elevator, then elevator will decided whether or not respond.
        Specified by:
        addRiderRequest in interface Elevator
        Throws:
